I love wearing headbands when I work out, and sometimes when I'm having a bad hair day. I love the varied selection that came in the 6 pack. Spring is coming and the colors are great! The shipment arrived on time and in good condition. I would order from this company again.

Love any like of "buff" headwear, I ususally use it around my neck, and pull up over ears, or mouth and nose in cold weather, or if I am cleaning horse stalls I use it to keep the dust out of my nose. Thin, but if its really cold, you can comfortably wear 2 . I leave one on my neck, and pull the other over my ears, eliminating the need for ear muffs most of this time. The 6 pack is a great value as well, will buy more!

I use these buffs sailing on the cold waters of Lake Michigan and running in the winter in Wisconsin.  They are versatile, colorful, and work perfectly as hair/head bands, ear cover, and neck warmers.  Love them and their colors!!

I am a skier, and I got these to keep me warm on the slopes, without adding lots of bulk. They have fancy brands at the store, that cost $16-$40 for just one of these. When I saw I could get a 6 pack for $13, I thought, "I will give it a shot, but these probably won't be any where near as good as the fancy ones." Boy was I wrong, these babies rocked, I was warm the whole time, and my boyfriend's overpriced fleece one got all snowy and he got cold.

Awesome lite weight material makes this a tolerable mouth cover during cold weather. It's is slightly big for my young children but excellent for teens and adults. Love the fact that it can have multiple uses.
these are great! good selection for price and great choice of designs and colors. I would order again and recommend

I have 2x expensive buffs that i use for hiking in all sorts of weather. These are not far off in quality.  I bought these for when my family goes hiking with me and they love em.  Good quality lightweight material that can be used in summer sun or winter storms.  Gonna buy a few more 6 packs for friends.  At this price its almost stealing.

reviewText: This is my second Deadpool suit, the first I had purchased from ebay nearly two years ago. As time passes, suits need replacing, so instead of buying another on ebay with the hopes it wouldn't be utter crap (I was lucky with my first one) I decided to check here. I was surprised that the suits available weren't much more expensive than those available on ebay, so I bought one and suggested one of my friends to check amazon for when she decides to do Ladypool. The suit was delivered in a reasonable amount of time, and is significantly better than my previous suit had been new. So yay!

There are a lot of badly made costumes out there but this is not one of them.  The seams are straight and tight, the body is in proportion and the material is strong.  My son loves it and it has survived Comic-con's and everyday play wear very well.  The recommended sizes seem to be right on.  A good product.
summary: Well made and surprisingly fast shipping

reviewText: I love this costume! Fits great! I have been wearing it on and off depending on whats going on. I wore it to a Magic the Gathering night. Several of my friends thought it fit my personality too well. This suit fit amazingly. I'm going as Deadpool next year at Dragcon con. It was depressing walking around as a Grfindoor only
Runs a little small.  I'm 5'7" and 150lbs and the medium was pretty tight on me, but it's an excellently made bodysuit.  Shipping was fast.

Alright, short but quick review. This product is from China, however, it is of a highly satisfactory quality.  I ordered a medium, i'm 5'5 with an athletic swimmer's body and it fit perfectly.  You can see thorough the white mesh quite well, and it has a zipper near the crotch so you can take a piss, which is great for a skin suit. And it does fit tight.

I'll be wearing this to many convention and halloween parties. Or whenever.

I honestly would totally recommend this company to anyone who was interested in buying a costume. The body suit is well constructed, durable, and looks SPOT ON. It even has a little front hole in case nature calls!
summary: Simply as close to perfect as you can get!

reviewText:
Alright, this isn't my first skin suit, unitard how ever you label it. I bought a green man suit for a sociology project a couple years back. So I have a little bit of 'experience' I guess with these costumes. I ordered this about 11 days ago. The one review said it arrived in his hand in a few days or something? I don't know his (or her's) location, but I live in Baltimore city. I was in no hurry to get it but it was estimated to arrive September 12 - October 3rd. It came in 2 weeks early (with standard shipping.) Props to them. I just wanted it to arrive before Halloween lol.

The Size: I ordered an adult men size medium, I'm 5'8... It fits perfectly.

The Mask: Besides the fact that it's removable, visibility through the eyes is about an 8 maybe 9 out 10. In well lit areas.
Although, the black part of the eyes (as you see in the picture) goes down a little bit further than the actual design in the comics.
But you can get away with it.

Pros: A zipper did come with the suit to go to the bathroom.. which is a definite plus. I missed that part in the summary I guess.

Cons: Might need a hand to help get the back zipper up all the way.

Overall, it's a good suit for the price, great for costume parties and any types of cons. (Going to wear it to Otakon next year!) I still need to assemble some of the weapon parts of the costume (plastic guns and the wooden swords, have the belt and holsters.) Hoped this helped, good luck guys.

I am a 5ft 3in girl who is 105lb I was going to order a small but trust me that would have been a mistake. The medium is skin tight so a small wouldn't have fit at all. the suit is what i expect and is pretty good material. I am not worried about splitting seams or it coming apart at all. The mask however is far too small to fit any adult head. Its a child size or something. Im not sure why they even bothered with it honestly. Since it is a mens suit it has a crotch zipper to go to the bathroom, the only issue i have with this is that it has this metal zipper that hangs down in between my legs that is a bit awkward. It is very tiny so im hoping to hold it down it something. Other than that this was a great buy.
summary: A great fit even for a girl

reviewText: This suit is perfect! I bought this so my 10 year old could wear it to Comicon. It fits great and the craftsmanship is a bonus! You won't be disappointed!
summary: You'll Be Happy You Bought It!

reviewText: Really dig the costume so did many others at this Halloween Rave I went to in Seattle... Good times... that being said... I am 5'4 benching above 200 so my chest is a bit larger for my size and man oh man this top part of the suit is super tight and a bit uncomfortable in the armpits... The mask couldve been done a little better too but for the price I feel you get a pretty nice costume... Next time I will order a size up though, because if you are like me then you must also be super flexible like me to get this on and even getting this on by myself was a struggle.
I bought this as a gift of my bf and he loves it! He can't wait to wear it to an anime/comic-con now.
The best. I thought a medium would be too small for a 5'7 125 pound guy but it fits as expected
summary: i was amazed by the quality for the price of the costume

reviewText:
Best thing I ever bought! I loved it! I bought a medium and wore it to SLC comic con and I was a celebrity for a day! Everyone wanted pics with me! I do have an athletic body so the suit fit perfect but I did end up ripping it due to my wide back! But that dosnt take away from the quality! The quality was great! I plan on buying another one soon but maybe in a large this time! I'm 5'6 and about 155lbs! Just to help you get an idea of size!

Also they say it takes 8 weeks cause it does come from china but I got mine in 7-9 days! Which was a relief!

reviewText: At first when i saw this on Amazon i thought to myself "hey I'll just buy the outfit and then buy a different mask for it"(since the mask looks a little off on the pictures). I love these, I had the previous iteration (or maybe two earlier?) and finally wore them out after several years. They are definitely a light-weight training shoe so I wouldn't get them if you are going to be doing a lot of running. But this also makes them extremely comfortable, I hadn't realized how hot running shoes made my feet until I switched to these. Good support and my feet stay cool all day, also noticeably light but well-made and long lasting.

I have worn them hiking in a pinch but don't really recommend it because the material is mesh-like and will let a lot of dirt in. But if you mainly take cardio classes and/or do weight training or just need something to wear around town look no further.

Super light-weight, decent arch support (mine is higher than average).  I was pleasantly surprised by the sole/tread on these for my circuit training classes, as I couldn't really tell by online pics.  Also pleasantly surprised that these ran ever so slightly bigger than Nike running shoes I use to wear 15+years ago - I always wore one to 1.5 sizes larger in their "Hurache's"/running shoes, so I was really worried my size 6 would be too small - there is actually more toe room in these shoes than any other size 6 shoe I own (athletic, heel, boot).  But it is the correct amount of room from big toe to edge of shoe for me (an inch or less, I don't want my big toe being jammed into edge of shoe when lunging, jumping, etc.).  Shoes arrived with an odd yellowish color on side of one shoe, but no damage to box, paper lining etc - I was happy that a clorox wipe easily cleaned the shoe and did not discolor any further.  I am very happy and highly recommend, although I have only worked out it once!
summary: Super light-weight, nice tread and arch support - love them so far!

If I could, I'd take away a 1/2 star for arch support - I have a slightly wider front of the foot and arches that are a little on the high side, so I do look for a good under the foot fit. I could probably tie the laces differently or put in an insole(they're pretty expensive), but as is, when I did a zumba class in these, my arch began to twinge :(
However, this is overall an awesome shoe that I will continue to stick with for going out, day to day walking, and for training and gym use (with the exception of running and zumba (although hip-hop was fine). The shoes have a great flexibility to them and don't look "dirty" easily. My previous pair of flex supreme TR 3s have lasted for a good 2 years and are just now on the verge of being worn out. This is the optimal sneaker that is flexible in more ways than one: from pointing you toes to leg-pressing, from gym use to shopping to adding a sporty edge to a dressy night out, the flex has it all.

I am a recess aide and on my feet all day long. I tried these shoes on in the store before purchasing them on Amazon. They are very lightweight and comfortable. I was surprised how great they felt. The second day; however, I got a pain in my hip to the point where I started limping. As soon as I got home and took them off, the pain was gone the rest of the evening. I'm only 30 by the way. Nothing else in my daily routine changed except wearing these shoes two days in a row. I don't understand why it would make my hip hurt since they are comfortable on my feet, but I'm sure that was the problem. I wore different shoes today and had no pain. I don't think as much as I am on my feet I will be able to wear them an extended amount of time. I will have to rotate wearing them every other day. For normal wear, I believe, people will be fine. I am literally walking or standing six hours a day straight.

**UPDATE: So, initially after wearing them, I had hip pain after wearing them. I don't know if they just needed to be broken in, but I wear them all the time now and have not experienced any pain since the first couple times of wearing them. They are comfortable, and I love them even more now.

I have ordered an original BM swimsuit, it was super nice but they are a little pricy. I have always wanted to order their leggings since they are so beautiful, however, I can't often afford them. And then I found this company makes the "same" things so I took a risk to order them. After all, if they are bad, it only costs me less than $10.

I was so surprised by the prints and color are perfect as picture. The fabric wise, it was subtle shinny and stretchy and comfortable. On that note, I compared to my real BM swimsuit, BM fabric was thicker and more "dense" which that is what you pay for, they wrap you up and tight you in, give you good shape, and it doesn't see though AT ALL. This company's fabric was slightly thinner, which doesn't tight you up as much as BM and if it is light color leggings, it is very little see-though to the panties (just very very little even it is light color leggings). However, I don't feel cheated at all. The fabric is still very nice, I guarantee you that you will feel such a good buy when you et them. Also you are supposed to wear something long to cove your butt to style it so little see-through is not a problem at all!

All in all, I might have second thought about ordering swim suit because they might not be thick enough but for leggings, I will not hesitated.

P.S. I got the great wave & white cross pairs.

Sooooo comfortable. I have one more pair that should be arriving soon, and I ordered FOUR MORE pairs this morning - you can't go wrong at this price! These are a terrific product and if you love leggings, you should try these. I have paid much more for much less well made leggings - and the other thing I forgot to mention is that these are opaque, so you don't have to worry about showing off more of you than you want to. Possibly my Best Buy of the Year so far!!!!

reviewText: Do not order this product!!! The seller had it posted as a newborn batman outfit with picture and everything and after I ordered it, it somehow changed to a Santa reindeer hat. Overall bad experience with this order.

I don't know why I was so stupid & thought I might get lucky. This hat looked NOTHING like the picture, and now suddenly the picture has changed on Amazon! I don't know if you're seeing an adorable picture of a brand new baby wearing a precious reindeer knit hat, but that is NOT what this hat looks like. Please believe me! The hat I received fits my NINE year old!! I think it would take at least 2 newborn heads to fit in this hat. It's really a shame that this seller hasn't changed this hat. It has the potential of being really cute. It doesn't even make sense, because they're wasting time & material adding rows that don't need to be there! I'm really bummed that I won't be able to give this to my best friend for the birth of her little boy next week!

BEWARE: This item used to be a reindeer hat before late November 2013. Other sellers may still be shipping that item if you attempt to buy the batman suit.

Old review:

The baby photo is not an accurate representation of this product. If you notice the other [accurate] photos, the red nose is on the bottom of the front, not a third of the way up like it is on the baby. Also, the antlers don't really stand up like they do in the baby photo.

These favor boxes were perfect for my use on a gold-themed dinner party table. Unlike other favor boxes they were small enough to fit, yet large enough to hold the glass baubles and chocolate truffle that were my chosen favors. Quick and easy to assemble. Good price.

I do like the appearance of these boxes but they are really small....even smaller than they appear in the picture.  They will hold a few almonds, mints etc. but not the pecans I planned to use.  They will not fold over if you put more than 5 or 6 small items.  Also the holes for the ribbon are too small so it is difficult to lace the ribbon through.  Good for perhaps  a small shower favor, but not for a couples party favor.

These looked very nice and arrived on time.  One complaint is that the enclosure is basically a sticker, and the card stock being kinda stiff made a bunch of them pop open.  We had to pinch them shut every once in awhile during the event before the guests picked them up.
summary: Classy looking, but not all sealed properly

I waited a long time for this dress to arrive when I bought it on eBay. Since it only came in one size I looked up a sizing chart to see if it might fit. When shopping I almost always wear a size small, with the exception of clothing such as Aeropostale where I wear a medium shirt size. I decided to order it and take the chance. When I tried it on it just barely fit. Not for anyone with a large bust. I had on a push up bra at a 34 C size and it was a bit tight. I'm 5,5" and the dress came to a bit above my ankles with the length. The fabric isn't very high quality but it felt pretty nice regardless. Beware of static though. The fabric of this dress can become extremely staticky and it will cling to you. The colors are bright and pretty. The main downside for me is that the pattern wasn't like the one in the picture. Instead of the top having the thick dark blue stripe it was a brown stripe with a little bit of blue on the edge. Also, the elastic gathering in the mid section looks somewhat cheap and poorly made. One weird thing about the dress was that mine had no tag at all and therefore no washing/care instruction. Overall the lightweight bright colored fabric is the strongpoint of the garment. I wasn't too satisfied with the dress as a whole so I cut off the top and turned the lower portion into a skirt.

Cute summer dress. Love the bright vibrant colors.  Very light weight.  Little sheer, but as a cover up was perfect.  I thought the chest part was really small.  And made me look boxy. But my daughter tried on and it looked great.  So not a total waste.  Happy overall

When I received this dress I was surprised at how pretty the dress looks; and the colors were so bold and bright.  The color combination is fantastic!!  I wore it right away to church and I will also be wearing this dress to work.  I could not wait to put it on.  One thing though, the dress was very wrinkled but it did not take away from the style.  I would ordered this dress again because of the pretty colors and it would be nice to see it in different bold colors.  I ordered a size small and the dress was somewhat a little tight at the top but not uncomfortable, although  a medium size would be too big because of the flare of the dress.  The material was chiffon and you can see through it so some may prefer to wear a slip.  The dress does run small in size, however for the price you pay and the beautiful colors in this dress, it is well worth it.  I would highly recommend this dress to others, it is a good buy.  You will not be disappointed when you buy this dress!!!
summary: Boho Bohemian Chiffon Stripes Summer Beach One Piece Sleeveless Dress is very pretty with bold colors as pictured.

I am 5'7" and 145 lbs. I got these jeans in size 9 and they fit perfectly. They go up high enough that I'm not *exposing anything* when I sit down, but not too high. The length is great, they are skinny but not constricting, and they don't stretch too much after wearing them. The only problem I had was the smell. When I got them, they had that "dark dye" smell that black jeans sometimes have, that smells like sulfur and rubber and nastiness. I had to wash them twice with detergent and twice with baking soda to get the smell out, and as a result, the color faded some (as I kind of expected it would). However, they smell fine now and they fit great, and the faded color isn't bad enough that I really notice it, so I would definitely recommend buying these jeans!

Worse, when I put the pants through the wash once, the elastic band got hopelessly twisted and tangled inside the pants and, despite an earnest 30-minute effort, I wasn't able to totally straighten it out. Of all the maternity pants I have purchased, these are hands down the most annoying, least comfy ones. Go with a set of maternity pants with no adjustable band and just a lot of stretch. A million times better.
summary: Adjustable elastic band uncomfy, annoying, and not nearly as useful as it sounds

reviewText: Bought these for a friend who is very picky and assuming that she told me the truth, she said they were "actually a very nice material." Giving it a four star because I personally did not get to see or feel them.

I want so badly to give these pants 5 stars! They fit just as expected, are extremely comfortable, have such a clever adjustable band that I know will carry me thought my pregnancy... But alas, there re two flaws I can't ignore. The reason I ordered these is so I could have opaque leggings to wear that don't need to be fully covered with a short dress or long shirt.  I wanted to be able to have a little bit of my butt peeking out from a shirt and not worry about anyone seeing underwear or skin, etc.  I noticed when bending over the fabric does get a bit see-through, and even when loosely gathered at my knees to pee I could see through the fabric to the floor (not perfectly, but definitely not opaque).  The other flaw is that there were puncture holes in the fabric all along the center seem from the crotch to back! Right now they are small puncture holes, but especially because of the placement in this seam they are bound to get bigger faster.  In the picture I have draped the pants over my purple hydro flask so you can see the holes.  This is certainly not a place I'd like growing holes.  I don't understand why the center seam was unable to be stitched without these punctures??!  So again, I totally want to give these 5 stars, but unfortunately cannot :(
summary: I want to give more, but I can't!

reviewText: Looser fit on the thighs for someone small-medium, at least in early pregnancy. The adjustable waist-band was a massive boon in early pregnancy when "morning" (ha ha!) nausea hit. reviewText:
These are super comfy and just the right size. The waist comes up high enough not to show the elastic across the middle of my stomach so it works well under snug shirts. It's also a great length (I'm 5'1" and they'd probably be a good length for anyone that or a few inches taller). They're also pretty soft, too, and opaque enough to wear like regular leggings.

I may just have to order these in every color now.

reviewText: These leggings are very short.

These are SO comfortable! They are fitted on my legs (but not skin tight) and then have a full panel that will fit over my belly throughout pregnancy. The waistband has an adjustable elastic band that you use to make the waistband tighter or looser as your belly grows. I've had a lot of trouble having things that are tight on my belly, so this is perfect! The material is also thick enough for these to be worn as pants without worrying about any see-through problems. It isn't quite as warm as my fleece leggings, but warm enough for cooler fall days.
summary: My favorite maternity pants so far!

reviewText: These are very comfortable. I am 5'4'' and in my 3rd trimester and they fit length and width wise. I ordered the medium. I do like that they come with a "belt" that you can pull smaller/larger around the stomach area.
summary: These are very comfortable. I am 5'4'' and in my 3rd trimester ...

reviewText: Love how comfortable they are

When your baby belly is getting rounder each day, the last thing you want to feel is constriction. These are so incredibly comfortable. The adjustable waist line strap is ingenious. It may not be the most well made pants in the world, but for this price, I have no complain. Plus, I wouldn't want to spend a lot of money on maternity clothing that is used a few month out of every few years. I got a pair of black and am coming back for another pair of different color, highly recommend.

This is quite a nice and unique garment - not too fancy nor too plain. THis would be ok for a dressy event, or as stated elsewhere, nice with jeans. Yes, it seems to run small - only 8-10 and 12/14PLUS were available, so I contacted the (very responsive) company and they advised to go ahead and order the plus size - and it worked. I note from the way it is designed that the cotton fabric could be stretched with an iron to provide more coverage across the bust if that is desired (a complaint I noted prior).

THe beadwork is not hand sewn, but appears to have been sealed in with some sort of fabric adhesive - quite a nice job, and no threads to loosen or come apart. The beads are tiny - the size of poppy seeds, and qute secure. It is a very nice garment and I have purchased in three colors!

I usually wear a small/medium but I  ordered a M/L, thinking bigger would be safer. Well since this bolero was so inexpensive I guess you are getting what you paid for. The sleeves are long which is great, as I usually find sleeves to run shorter. It's large across the shoulders but fits smaller or funny at the arm pits and doesn't close or sit that nicely on the front. I may just give it away or use it for a casual outfit as this is a jersey style finish to the cuffs and overall look. It's still kind of nice for jeans.

They offered me a $3 refund - when I asked how I would get that - they didn't respond to the question and closed my claim. I refiled a claim and I chose the Amazon option of a credit for the item. reviewText:
I love, love, love these socks and will be buying another pair -- but that's the only reason I have to give them fewer than 5 stars. I thought they would be fun and flashy socks for working out (like some of the fun CrossFit socks), but they're not thick enough to withstand that. I ended up with holes in them the first time I wore them and had to throw them away.

So they're really cute and fun for everyday regular wear, but you'll need something thicker if you're wanting to work out or run in them.
summary: Awesome socks for fun everyday wear, but too delicate for workouts and runs.

reviewText: I have several Sock-It-To-me knee socks, and they are so cute, unique, and comfortable, and even look good on an old woman like me, LOL.  I like a light knee sock for winter, and this is a fantastic brand, but kinda expensive. I just bought two different "cat" theme socks, and one pair of "dragon" socks for my grown daughter and she fell in love with them. And the quality is very nice.
Too small, made for younger girls or girls with very skinny legs.
These are great socks, and look exactly as pictured.  If you like dragons, get these socks!  Unlike some novelty socks, these seem to hold up well for regular use.
They fit well (I wear size 8 wide) without binding the toe, and don't bind at the knee. Such beautifully designed knee socks! I purchased the whole set of 11!

A bit tight on the calf - if your calves are over 15", you may want to skip these socks.

Socks are well made and of a comfortable knit.  Socks do reach to the knee of a 5' 7" female. All around good sock.  Not made for folks with heavier calves, though.

Lots of stretch in calves, length will bring the top all the way to the bottom of the kneecap, Foot is generous.  I have several different pairs that come out of the wash just as nice as they went in and show no ill effects from drying on medium heat.  Love the fact that the socks are mirror-images of one-another so you can have the same design showing on both sides.
summary: Bright graphic design, comfortable fit for an adult, not a stick

reviewText: I'm a real fan of SOCK IT TO ME and its range of funky, fun socks. I like wearing these and having my own private joke to keep me smiling no matter what. They fit well, too.

My calves are relatively thin but not toned so the fit is not as smooth as I would like. At places where the design is they tighten a bit so they seem "drawn" and the shape of my calf is not smoothly contoured but it's not too obvious and not uncomfortable so maybe they'll get a little looser in time.
summary: Beautiful with a small fitting issue

reviewText: Bright and fun! These socks are so cute and comfy! Lots of compliments. I'm very pleased with these. I love socks!

These socks are fabulous!  The design is so striking, and I find the construction of the sock to be excellent.  Only two comments that brought the rating down to a four-star from a five:  (1)  While the body of the sock fits well, the socks are a bit tight at the top.  I don't mind a snug fit, but I do find I want to take them off in the middle of the night if I go to sleep with them on; and (2) I didn't realize that there would be so many threads on the inside of the sock.  Yes, the design is intricate, but I guess I figured part of the design would be printed, not knitted.  That is my bust on not knowing better; however, all those threads can pose a real "snag" hazard.  I've figured a way around it in putting on the socks, but it would have been a nice "heads up."  Overall, I would buy Sock It To Me socks again because of the wonderful designs and good quality.

I have a love of socks now that I've found this brand.  So many more I want to buy, and I will buy in the future.  The unique patterns are freaking amazing.  At Christmas this is all I wanted...great socks!

Lots of stretch in calves, length will bring the top all the way to the bottom of the kneecap, Foot is generous.  I have several different pairs that come out of the wash just as nice as they went in and show no ill effects from drying on medium heat.  Love the fact that the socks are mirror-images of one-another so you can have the same design showing on both sides.
summary: Comfortable fit for an adult, engaging graphic

reviewText:
I purchased the Sock It To Me Women's Knee High Dandelion Print Sock because I loved the print and was not disappointed when they arrived.  You get what you see as far as the print is concerned.  Very cute design.  I was not expecting them to be mid-calf length (I am 5'5" tall) and was pleasantly surprised to find that they fit my calf (I normally wear a wide shaft boot).  I like the material they are made of - much thinner than an athletic sock, but not too thin.  They are also a little softer than a traditional trouser sock.  My preference would have been either a trouser sock or knee-high length.  The mid-calf is not flattering on me.  Because they hit right at the thickest part of my calf, you could see the line/indention through my jeans.  They did not leave a mark and they were not tight, it was simply due to the placement.  I will more than likely slouch them the next wear to avoid this issue.  The foot fit perfectly.

I did receive this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review.
I love the socks, attractive and easy to put on.

I normally have loved my Sock It To Me purchases, but the very first time I wore these they ended up with a hole in them.  Seems the fabric on these socks is thinner than my other purchases.  Still loved the design and hoping I can sew up the hole to get some more use out of them.  Just not sure they'll hold up well at all.
summary: I normally have loved my Sock It To Me purchases

reviewText:
I have only had these socks for a week, so this review is based on fit, comfort and style, not durability.

For reference on fit: I am a tall and chubby lady, and I like my knee socks socks to land at a place that is 18" high, just under my knee cap. The circumference of the largest part of my calf is 17". These socks do not come up all the way, rather about 2 inches below my kneecap, and then fall down fairly quickly so they fit more like a tall crew sock, hovering a little below half of my calf height. I have had other socks from Sock It To Me, and I know that not all of them will fit me, but I am disappointed that these do not. I think they would fit a shorter, skinnier person well, but maybe not someone who was short and chubby or tall and skinny. 2 stars for fit.

As far as comfort goes, they feel nice on my feet. These socks are not going to make my feet too hot, but they are a little thinner than I would really like.  Not very thin like trouser socks, but not much thicker than that. The socks conform well to my feet with no awkward or uncomfortable bits. They do not cut into my calves, or anywhere else. 4 stars for comfort.

In terms of style, this sock is quite cute.  Who wouldn't want a trail of wishes floating around their legs?  The colors and pattern are true to the stock photo.  4 stars for style.

Sock It To Me is a great brand that I've purchased before, but this sock fails to impress me.  I will still wear them, but it's not the all out love, or even strong like that I was hoping for.

I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Cute but not for chubby ladies

I had some concerns buying Jeans online. The listing is not as descriptive as I would have liked. Its very hard to find flare jeans lately, even on the internet. I have been buying Amethyst brand jeans and wear a size 18 (I had to stop because they seem to be incapable of admitting their "flare" jeans are now actually bootcut and not even close to flare). I am on the larger size, but am 5' 10" and have large proportions all around. I have larger muscular thighs and calves which makes finding jeans difficult. I ordered these in a size 20 because I was afraid of them fitting small. Many brands claim to be size 18, but usually fit more like a 16 in the hips and waist, and are much too small in the thighs.

Overall fit-wise, these are a little loose on me, as I hoped they would be (having ordering a size up and not having much of a butt) and I have yet to wash them to see how they shrink, or don't shrink, the legs are nice and wide, not tight in the knees and calves. the flare when lying flat is about 20", which gives it a nice flow at the bottom. Also, the image is definitely of the regular junior sizes. The plus sizes are higher waisted, rising about two or so inches below the belly button, so it doesn't give you muffin-top or show any "crack" when you sit.

As for length, these fit great! Being tall, it's hard to find pants that I would wear with anything other than flats. I generally like my jeans to touch the ground (they usually end up getting walked on and frayed) some people may think these are too long if you prefer a fit more about the ankle.

Color is generally the same as I expected. The image shows it lighter than it arrived, but I like it darker (however, these are not "dark" just a shade or two more than the image). I think darker jeans are more work appropriate (if you can wear them to work), which is what I needed these for (professional office). The color will most likely fade a little bit to more of the image color after a dozen or so washes.

Overall the material is thinner than the jeans I have been buying through Amethyst, but the jeans I bought there were exceptionally heavy. So it is probably more of a standard weight material than I think it is.

We sent it back for repair, then the watch began being way too slow, so I purchased this winder. Now my watch is consistently slow by about a couple minutes, even when I set it faster, but at least it's not fifteen to twenty minutes off, so I'll keep it and continue using the winder. Some people may need to know that they need to keep the watch on the winder for at least two full days and keep playing with which setting on the winder works best.
summary: At least my son doesn't have to return my watch

reviewText: Works perfectly and Silent!!!!  Recommended by my watch repairman.  Works perfectly and looks great.  Fit my small wrist watch and my husbands large watch perfectly.  Great product may order another one.

So far so good. Does what it's supposed to do. My watch is keeping accurate time and it's good to know I can pick up and use without having to reset things (I know, kind of a first-world problem). In any case, it's inexpensive and does what it's supposed to do. My only con is that it doesn't really suggest or tell you about the settings. I realize all watched are different but there must be some standard? No idea.
summary: Great price, does what it's supposed to do.

reviewText: hightly recommend it! watch now keeps perfect time and does not need to be reset when he puts it on:)
It works like a charm!  It does exactly what it is supposed to do.  What's not to like?  I am pleased.

This thing definitely does its job, and has more options than a previous company/model I owned. You have three options that have different timers for run/stop when winding your watch. I like the flip up cover as opposed to removable cover also, but that's just personal preference. Long as this thing keeps running I'll be very happy with it. I've heard of watch winders quitting after X amount of months. Hopefully that won't happen here. My last one actually lasted a very long time (years) before just quitting for no reason.

I've only had this a week now, but so far so good.  Very quite, noise less is more like it. and it keeps my automatic watches ready to go.  Can't ask for much more, am going to order another.  I like the style as well as the reasonable price.  Will follow up at a later time with more info.

This is all I need to keep my Rolex watch running when I'm not wearing it every day.  I never even knew watch winders existed until I found them by accident.  Guess I'm behind the times..  This winder already had good reviews, and I liked the style, so I decided to buy it.  I'm very glad that I did.  I would recommend this watch winder to anyone needing a reliable basic tool.
Good value. Keeps my old Rolex submariner wound and on date when I wear another watch. suggested by Rolex repair guy

It looked like a great gadget to keep my automatic watch functioning even if I don't wear it all the time, and the reviews of it were generally positive.  But my watch doesn't have an adjustable wristband --it's a metal bracelet with one of those hinged closures that was sized for me by removing links, so there's no way to adjust the watch to fit the device.  I returned it immediately.

reviewText: I was not expecting them to be so soft! They are really comfortable!

I love these. I wear a US Women's size 7, and they fit perfectly and stay on. The elastic doesn't itch or bind at all, at least on me. The only problem is that lint keeps coming out of them forever, every time you take them off, and after a lot of wear and washes, they get kind of felted on the bottom and aren't as soft or fuzzy anymore. The lint doesn't stop coming until they aren't soft and fluffy anymore. I love the fuchsia and gray the best. Wish there was a pack without baby blue and especially pink, but the feel is more important than the looks.
These socks are comfortable and I can wear them all day long. they are snug and a perfect fit for my feet.

These slipper socks are just what I was looking for, and the 4-color set comes packaged as separate pairs, so you can share them with your cold-footed friend.  The colors are vivid and seem color-fast in washing.  The material is very soft, but with a good no-slip tread added on the bottom, which is slightly perceptible when wearing on bare floors.

I have two minor complaints, echoed in other reviews:
- The elastic is sewn a bit high on the foot, so I feel it too much at the top-front of my ankle.  It is not chafing, but I am definitely aware of it in a way that I wouldn't be if it went across only the top of my foot instead of the front of my ankle.
- As it is a chenille-type fabric, it does tend to drop puffy little balls of colored lint all over the place, especially when new.  I would advise caution if washing by machine with other lint-attracting items like towels.

However, the material is soft and thick, so they keep my feet warm (and I also sometimes wear them inside boots), the colors are deep and pretty, and the price is good for the quality of the product.

They really did, they fit true to size. Only complaint is all the fuzz they gave off for the first washing or two. Other than that no complaints here, they stay soft after washing, and have gripper bottoms.
These socks are great for wearing around the house.  The strap keeps them on and makes them fit great.  2nd time I bought them.
Love these soft lounging socks. Can't wait to get home and put them on. Exactly what I wanted and the four pack is great. Always have a pair clean to enjoy.
The grey pair had a hole in them, had to return them. the elastic band seemed a little misplaced, it was too close to my ankle area.

These are pretty great slipper socks. They are incredibly soft and very stretchy. I wear a women's US size 6.5 in shoes, and these socks are a little loose on my feet, although they do stay on. The tread on the bottom is not very aggressive and does not extend to the heel of the sock, so you only get gripping power at the ball of the foot. They are plush but not very densely woven, so they will not keep your feet warm if there is a cold draft around.

Mine arrived as four individually packaged pairs, great for sharing.

Made in China.

I am 5' 4 1/2" 155lbs. I can normally get away with wearing a medium in most clothing. So, with a sweater or jacket, I would normally get a large. But, because Patty usually runs just a tad smaller, I ordered an x-large. It is just a touch big, but not really baggy. And with a sweater, I prefer to not have it too close fitting, anyway. The feel of the fabric is sooooo soft and comfortable. I have had this for several days, now, and I love wearing it so much, that I have even worn it around the house a fair bit. It's got a good, close knit, so it's fairly warm to wear outside. Been wearing it outside in 40 to 50 degree weather, with short sleeved shirts and felt fine with it. But, it's not heavy or hot when I wear it inside, either.
I do worry about the belt loops, as they are kind of thin, but I just removed the belt, as I don't really like to tie it, anyway. The sleeves are a little long, like in the picture. I kind of like that, personally. But, it's easy enough to just roll them up, too. And it still looks cute like that! Shipping was fast, as it often is with Patty items. And the quality of the product is excellent, as I'm learning to expect from them, as well. Would definitely recommend this item. I'm almost tempted to buy another before they run out, as a back up for when this one wears out. :-P

reviewText:
EDITED 6/14/2016: Still living in this sweater. If Patty no longer carries it, too bad. Best purchase I've made through her and pretty much anything. Both sweaters still look new and are comfortable and warm, but breathe so you don't get overwarm.

EDITED 7/15/2014 - I LIVE in these sweaters!!! Because of several health issues, I live near the ocean but must keep the humidity as low as I can get it (how unfair is,that???). So, I sleep on the sweaters (not both together), and if I wake up cold in the night, I wrap myself in these wonderful, soft, hearty sweaters. They have been washed many times and hung to dry, and they still look brand new. They have become like blankets to me! Best purchase I have ever made. Patti, you are a genius! Thank you for these sweaters. Don't ever stop carrying them!

EDITED: 3/30/2014 - I ended up getting another one of these sweaters in black & white (there's a name for that that escapes me). Now I have TWO of these wonderful sweaters and have washed the dark tan sweater and I have to say, it still looks awesome! In fact, now that it is FINALLY getting a little warmer here, I often don't need the sweater any longer. Woke up this morning, was freezing, forgot I left my black/white one out in the living room - did I grab my poor neglected fuzzy bath robe? No! I got the dark tan one out of my closet and have been loving it since. Still in love, now with TWO sweaters! ALMOST makes me regret upcoming summer :-). I am going to give this sweater 10 stars and if you like cozy, soft slightly big sweaters to curl up in, get it. You can always send it back if it isn't your style!

Original review: When I first opened the beautiful box they ship their clothing in (classy touch!), I admit, I was a little let down. It was bulky and the color wasn't great and I almost sent it back. Thank GOD I didn't send it back. It is extremely soft and cozy, as others have remarked. I wear a lot of black, so I wanted to buy it in black, but I don't think it comes in black. The weather here in Maine has been all over the place since November, one day 40 degrees F, the next 5 degrees F. Because I like to sleep quite cool @58 degrees, it's been crazy. I go to bed in a T-shirt, wake up four hours later and it's 53 degrees in the room. I went perusing my closet and grabbed Patti's sweater. I have LIVED in it since!! I don't care if it matches my outfit or not, I think this is my favorite sweater of all time. I end up sleeping in it, and it's like sleeping on five down pillows!!! I pull the hood over my eyes and nose, and I am so toasty when I wake up, it's hard to get myself out of bed. BUT, it's so versatile and well made, nobody would ever think I sleep in it! So, I can say without hesitation, I am in love with a sweater!! I walked thru Wal Mart the other day and saw one just like it by one of their vendors at half the price. I tried it on. The softness wasn't there, it was badly made, it wasn't even close to Patti's sweater. I felt much better! So far, PATTI has the best clothes of any vendor I have checked. Do yourself a favor, splurge on this sweater if you really feel the cold. I believe there is some rabbit fur in it, so if you are allergic to the fur, don't get it (and I am SO sorry). It is well made, even though it was a knitted sweater with large needles, I have, as I said, worn it a lot and no pulls or breaks in the yarn. It still looks like the day I took it out of the box. My poor fuzzy bathrobe has been replaced!!! Thank you, once again, PATTI! You clothing always makes me smile and feel so comfortable and stylish. Greatest women's clothing out there in my opinion!
summary: PATTI HITS IT OUT OF THE PARK ONCE AGAIN!

Not very itchy except for the tag which I have since cut out. Although the description is labelled as one size fits all it said "Medium" on the tag.

reviewText: I read every review and compared height and weight before ordering this sweater. I knew it would be a loose fit, and that's the style, and you can tell when you get the sweater, that's how it's supposed to be. I'm 5'0, 115 lbs, and i have to tuck in the bottom because I could probably wear it as a dress otherwise, HOWEVER, like I said, I knew it would be big, I just didn't think it would be that big. I'd say it's a medium. I'm usually a small. It didn't stop me from wearing it all December, and getting a million compliments on it. The reindeer don't really look like reindeer....more like the dachshund dog wearing the antlers in How the Grinch Stole Christmas. If you're looking for a sweater for an ugly christmas sweater party, or something festive for opening gifts, this is a great sweater. Very warm and comfortable!

At first I thought this to be a very strange sweater, but I've come to love it and wear it often. Hand wash, lay flat to dry. The knitted material feels enjoyably soft and is on the thinner side, perfect for layering with an undershirt. The colour is such a vibrant shade of red, very striking and I rather like it. The pattern is horrible, the reindeer look more like chihuahuas with antlers. The sleeves are just long enough to be appropriate, but then the body of the sweater is extra long and versatile; it covers my bum completely if paired with leggins, but also looks well bunched up for a voluminous look with denims. If you are anything other than a petite woman by American standards, I would not attempt to buy this product; I am 5'2" and 107 lbs, and it fits me perfectly. The only reason I did not rate higher stars is on account of A.) two 1" parallel gouges in the knitting on the right of the chest that appears to be a flaw in the manufacturing and B.) it smells funny, so douse it in perfume or wash it straight away. My guy says it smells like machine oil, eww.

I love this sweater.  It fits a little tight across the chest but it's not too small and I'm a heavy set girl.  I really enjoy wearing it.  It's not too thick but thick enough to be warm.  The fabric isn't scratchy like some sweaters.  I like it.

this is supposedly a one size fits all. well i assume everyone get the same one so just FYI its a women's medium that i received. Im 5'3" 105 pounds and it fits great could even be smaller but i like it to be a little slouchy anyways.  seems of good quality so far although i haunt washed it yet. very cute!

This sweater is exactly what I was looking for.  I really like it.  It is soft, warm (although it is a light weave), a little baggy (such is the trend), bright and totally cheesy!- Just like I wanted.
The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I don't see how anyone much larger than me can fit it.  So definitely not one size fits all.  It fits me great...I am 5'2" at 110lbs.  I normally wear a small, and that's what this seems to be.  I certainly wouldn't expect it to stretch either.  So if you normally need a medium or large, take heed.
summary: Just what I was looking for

I purchased the Ninimour-Fashion Summer Print Bodycon Dress in blue because I really liked the colors and how well they meshed together. The dress itself looks larger than expected in person, but it clings to my figure quite nicely--the length isn't too short (being 5'1" and pear-shaped this is actually quite a feat) and it doesn't ride up when I walk: another bonus. The dress is a bit sheer, so I'm thinking of purchasing a black slip to go underneath. The colors, unfortunately, are wrong. For the dress I purchased, anyway. Much less turquoise and red, and much more dark blue and orange instead. The pattern is also a larger print with not quite as many details. Still, for the price and the dress itself--the material is silky-smooth--I like it quite a bit, even though it isn't exactly what I had anticipated.
summary: Not quite what I expected, but not dissatisfied

Not only is this ring thick in width (10mm), but it is also thick from inside to outside. I'd say about 2mm. It's much thicker than any other ring I have. If you are going to purchase one, I'd go a half size smaller. I like the ring too much to not have it fit properly. You will be happy with this ring, especially at this price.

I have been wearing this ring for about a month now and really like it.  I got this ring because I'm a construction laborer and we use wire cables quite often for lifting.

Pros: this ring is very appealing to the eyes,  shiny bit not too much for a man. It's very affordable.  It's also very masculine with a classy look.

Cons: this ring has very sharp edges, and it's a little thicker and bigger than I'm used to. I have gotten used to it after wearing but for me it's a casual ring. I couldn't wear it to work.

Overall I'm very satisfied and would recommend it to a friend, not one near me because I love the uniqueness of this ring!

There is a snug elastic strap that goes around your body. These straps have never seemed to fit me in the right place. It does not fall just under my bust but rather a bit further down. I am a bit long in the torso. If you pull it up to just under your bust, which is hard to do because of how snug the top is, the top of the back of the suit is a bit affected. For me, that would not be a deal breaker for this suit. On the positive side, it's of good quality, very attractive, never rides up and the straps will never slide down. It also gives you a very nice shape. The built in bra does a good job. I use the suit for swimming and water aerobics. If you have large hips you may want to purchase one size up just so you can get it on(cross straps). If you are larger than a C cup, you may want to skip this one or go two sizes up. However doing that may give you too loose of a fit below the waist. Im keeping it. I think those straps have met their match and will eventually loosen under the pressure of traveling over my ample hips.

reviewText: My second pair

I have tried at least 6 different manufacturers of wear-over sunglasses in the past 2-3 years.  While most are tolerable, they generally all look like the glasses you get when you leave your eye doctor--not exactly something to wear often in public.  However, as a life-time prescription glasses wearer, I have found that I use the wear-overs far more frequently than if I were to switch to my Rx sunglasses--which is a pain.  I can easily flip the wear-overs off/on, much like regular sunglasses.  This is obviously good for my eye health.  The Duco semi-rimless glasses are lightweight (which might be a concern regarding durability), but what I like is the frame is only partial, and there are no large side-shields.  While the lack of side shields does allow some sun to enter from the periphery (which is not an advantage for activities like fishing), the glasses look much more "normal", and my wife even complimented me on their looks.  I also like that they do not have separate nose bridge/pads.  They are designed to rest on the top of my existing glasses, which is very comfortable.  My only negative is that I wish I could buy these in non-polarized plastic.  I am a pilot, and the polarized lens interferes with the screen of my iPad and iPhone when I fly, which I use for navigation and other flight information.  But all in all, a great product.  I will be buying a few more pairs as spares.
summary: The best wear-over sunglasses I have purchased

After reading some reviews, I decided to gamble on a cheap bathing suit. I'm so glad I did! It's adorable, and not as flimsy as you might expect. I'm glad I read reviews, because it does run a little small. The large bottoms fit me perfectly, but the top is still a bit small. I can imagine that for bustier girls, this suit is probably not an option. The top is heavy on the push-up factor, which is nice for girls like me who are not so gifted in that department, but even so, I am a little scared of the girls "popping out," so I wouldn't suggest this if you are of a more generous bust size.

I normally wear a size 6 or 8 in clothes and depending on the bathing suit, an 8 or 10.  Other reviewers said this suit ran small, so I ordered the smallest size left, which was a 12.  The bottoms fit fine but the top is the roughly the proportion of the sail on a boat.  And seriously, when will women's bathing suit manufacturers learn that if a customer has a chest, that tankini tops needs to provide support around the back, as in a tie or a strap that fastens, not just cloth that hangs down slackly.  What's up with that?  In what world does just a halter tie support anything?  There's a useless string under the bust in the front to more or less cinch things up, but without something that ties around the back, what good does a string in the front do?  This is just physics.  Take away the flapping cloth bottom and you have a backless halter with a chicken string in the front.  Now, bend over.  Voila, you fall out of your own suit.  I'm  56 years old, will never wear a two piece again, and  with a 28F bra size, am obviously never finding a one piece that fits.  I'm beyond disappointed.  I thought this suit was the answer - and loved it that there's no dumb gap between the tankini top and the bottoms.  I'm sending this back and never dealing with tankinis again.  Too bad about the boy shorts - they're very cute but bear no relationship to the top.

Artculo equivocado en color

I love these, I had the previous iteration (or maybe two earlier?) and finally wore them out after several years. They are definitely a light-weight training shoe so I wouldn't get them if you are going to be doing a lot of running. But this also makes them extremely comfortable, I hadn't realized how hot running shoes made my feet until I switched to these. Good support and my feet stay cool all day, also noticeably light but well-made and long lasting.

I have worn them hiking in a pinch but don't really recommend it because the material is mesh-like and will let a lot of dirt in. But if you mainly take cardio classes and/or do weight training or just need something to wear around town look no further.

Super light-weight, decent arch support (mine is higher than average).  I was pleasantly surprised by the sole/tread on these for my circuit training classes, as I couldn't really tell by online pics.  Also pleasantly surprised that these ran ever so slightly bigger than Nike running shoes I use to wear 15+years ago - I always wore one to 1.5 sizes larger in their "Hurache's"/running shoes, so I was really worried my size 6 would be too small - there is actually more toe room in these shoes than any other size 6 shoe I own (athletic, heel, boot).  But it is the correct amount of room from big toe to edge of shoe for me (an inch or less, I don't want my big toe being jammed into edge of shoe when lunging, jumping, etc.).  Shoes arrived with an odd yellowish color on side of one shoe, but no damage to box, paper lining etc - I was happy that a clorox wipe easily cleaned the shoe and did not discolor any further.  I am very happy and highly recommend, although I have only worked out it once!
summary: Super light-weight, nice tread and arch support - love them so far!

reviewText: These shoes look really great. However, slightly loose. The problems with lack of support arose when I exercised. It feels like there is little to no support in them. Possibly this is a shoe more geared for an office environment or short walking distances.

If I could, I'd take away a 1/2 star for arch support - I have a slightly wider front of the foot and arches that are a little on the high side, so I do look for a good under the foot fit. I could probably tie the laces differently or put in an insole(they're pretty expensive), but as is, when I did a zumba class in these, my arch began to twinge :(
However, this is overall an awesome shoe that I will continue to stick with for going out, day to day walking, and for training and gym use (with the exception of running and zumba (although hip-hop was fine). The shoes have a great flexibility to them and don't look "dirty" easily. My previous pair of flex supreme TR 3s have lasted for a good 2 years and are just now on the verge of being worn out. This is the optimal sneaker that is flexible in more ways than one: from pointing you toes to leg-pressing, from gym use to shopping to adding a sporty edge to a dressy night out, the flex has it all.

Average of 8 miles a week and then sprints twice a week on a treadmill. Just after running with these 3 times, I am having major back issues that I have never had before.

MY STATS and other shoes:
I road and trail run. I run on my tip toes on the treadmill and a lot of heal on the road. I am 5'6 169lbs with more muscle than an average runner. Built more like a sprinter than a marathon runner.
I LOVE Nike FLEX bottoms. They really give me support and flex needed. I have also used Asics and Puma.

The second day; however, I got a pain in my hip to the point where I started limping. As soon as I got home and took them off, the pain was gone the rest of the evening. I'm only 30 by the way. Nothing else in my daily routine changed except wearing these shoes two days in a row. I don't understand why it would make my hip hurt since they are comfortable on my feet, but I'm sure that was the problem. I wore different shoes today and had no pain. I don't think as much as I am on my feet I will be able to wear them an extended amount of time. I will have to rotate wearing them every other day. For normal wear, I believe, people will be fine. I am literally walking or standing six hours a day straight.

**UPDATE: So, initially after wearing them, I had hip pain after wearing them. I don't know if they just needed to be broken in, but I wear them all the time now and have not experienced any pain since the first couple times of wearing them. They are comfortable, and I love them even more now.

Cute blazer. I wear a medium but decided to order a large, afraid it would run small. Thankfully I did, because it runs small. So the large fits perfectly. The material looks and feels like polyester/rayon. Doesn't look expensive, but it's cute with a pair of jeans. The sleeves fit my arms well, which isn't always the case since my arms are slightly muscular in size. The 3/4 sleeve is cute but if you do a lot of elbow bending the jacket becomes uncomfortable because the sleeves end at the crease of my elbow. You can roll up the sleeve to prevent the discomfort of the sleeve, but then you lose the yellow in the cuff and I was only able to roll up once. It was too snug in the sleeves to roll up twice. So, I scrunched up the sleeve above my elbow to keep the yellow showing. Worked much better this way. This jacket has no stretch at all, so I suggest order up a size and have it tailored if necessary. My only issue is with the five inch long zipper in the front. It should be longer or no zipper at all. And in fits like a double breasted jacket if zipped, but has no button on the inside to keep the jacket from bunching up on the inside. Looks best unzipped, but I'm going to have a snap closure added on the inside so I can wear it zipped up for a sleeker look with a A line skirt. The jacket is Royal blue and canary yellow, which is the exact colors I was looking for. Very pleased.

I received this sweatshirt and it fits perfectly. I ordered a XL as I normally wear a size 8-10 in Women's.  The only thing I was disappointed with was the hood on this sweatshirt appears to be more of a fur on the picture, which is what I wanted.  What I received was fleece. Overall I really like it, fits well and comfortable, so I will keep it.

I am incredibly pleased with this sweatshirt! It is one of the softest, most comfortable items I own. The exterior is a thick, durable cotton/polyester blend. I can't say enough about how great the inside feels - the interior is a fleecy cotton that just makes you want to say "ahh". Considering the cost of this sweatshirt, I am pleasantly surprised by its quality. The cut and stitching are excellent. No loose threads or awkward seams. The zippers (yes, plural - this is a double zip sweatshirt, which is actually pretty neat) are exceptionally shiny and sturdy - they really look great.  The pockets - love, love, love them! They are so spacious and warm.

Regarding size - I recommend ordering a size (or two!) up, depending upon your desired fit. I'm 5'4 and 125lbs. To counteract shrinking (this is cotton, remember) and to ensure a roomy fit, I purchased a size XL - great decision. It fits perfectly.

One final thing - although this sweatshirt is hooded, this more of a style feature rather than a functional hood. The hood is very short, presumably to ensure that it drapes evenly across the shoulders. While the hood will always look fabulous, don't count on it saving you in the rain!
Very happy, be sure to order a size up if you prefer a comfy large fit.

reviewText:
For the price, these are the best gloves I've ever owned. They don't cost much at all, so they aren't finely finished or fancy, and some threads are loose, but they do the job.

Love them!
summary: You get what you pay for and, in this case, it's a good thing.

I wear this scarf all the time, it was surprisingly warmer than I expected. So I wear it a lot in the winter. The material is light enough that I will wear it all day long, usually double looped under my coat but only in one loop if wearing it around the office all day as it can get to be too warm if you're running around a lot, although if you're in a cold office like mine, the double loop might not be bad if your just at your desk. I love the material too, its nice and soft, just keep it away from velcro or anything that it could get stuck on, it will pull threads on the scarf. Also, I love the bird pattern, and I love the 2 tone coloring of the Navy/Cream pattern, it's very pretty and I get compliments on it regularly.
summary: Love this scarf - very pretty and very warm

reviewText: I am 5'5 and 145. I have a very small waist 34A cup and 38 hips. The top doesn't stay straight up on the chest. It kept wanting to fold open in the slit.. The dress looked great on me but it kept riding up all night so I spent too much time pulling it down.

I love this dress. I went out and all eyes on me. If you're a medium I advise you to order a large. The dress is everything.  I ordered the blue dress. I will be ordering the black one as well.. This dress is a must have

I ordered the medium blue mini dress, and I have to say that I love it, buuut there are some things to mention that whoever is buying this should know like: the seller says the dress is 95% polyester and 5% cotton, when in fact it's 100% polyester. Also, as for the sleeves they aren't TOO BAD like the other reviewers have been talking about. Honestly, I think the model in the photo does a good job hiding them with her hair, BUT DON'T GET ME WRONG, this does not affect how I feel about the dress!
I'm a littttle out of shape due to an injury but I'm back in action, so this dress is a little tight (I'm 5'6 and 142 lbs at the moment), but I'm hoping since I've been working out it will fit perfect! But regardless, the design of the dress hides any insecurities! If I wore it tomorrow night I'd still feel SUPER HOT! ...which reminds me, the skirt is short! Doable, but short, I wouldn't wear this around my grandparents.
Overall, it's a BEAUTIFUL color, great material, just a TAD on the small side but hoping after some wearing and working out it will loosen up! I DO NOT REGRET BUYING, ESPECIALLY FOR THE PRICE!

The dress itself is great, fits perfectly and quality is good but sleeves are huge and you need to tailor it. If you have such opportunity to tailor it somewhere then order it without even thinking. Delivery takes only couple of days, customer service is quick in response.
This dress is so sexy that I cannot wait to wear it out.  I tried it on and my daughter just loved it.  I was so glad that she could not fit it.

first of all, the dress it's really nice, it fit a little big thou, but no biggie... second of all, dress came in with some damaged issues, I would have to take to get fix, and adjust size.. other than that it's all good. Color is very nice
summary: Nice dress, it's just size a little bigger

reviewText: These tights are perfect for my halloween costume.

I ordered almost 2 sizes up, because these things usually look better and last longer if they aren't tight,  I was between sizes, and I figured better safe than sorry ...but I forgot to consider length.  Unless you're over 5'4", or at the top of the weight range, the 3x-4x will be way too long.  I may order a size down, and cut off the legs on these and use them as stockings.

reviewText: I ended up ordering a Plus Size, because everyone was saying these run super small. I'm 5'0" and weigh 117 and the Plus Size fits me perfectly. It's not baggy. I love these so much!  Excited to where them for my cosplay!

I ordered the 3x-4x tights (though the package I received says 1x-2x on the back), but they fit perfectly! They are definitely tights and NOT leggings, as the white is see-through enough that you can faintly see my tattoo.  The lower part of the legs is not snug but I like the looser feel, and the thigh area fits snugly as you would expect tights to fit. The material is also nice and soft . Overall, I am pleased with them.

It's perfect and exactly what I was looking for!

This could be a decent visor--the bill is smaller than I expected, but that is probably because it is not intended to be a large style visor.  The strap in the back has a little bit of stretch to it which is good. The strap is also adjustable as shown in the picture.  The material seemed nice and the visor  is attractive. I ordered the royal blue. My complaint is that in sending the visor from the supplier, it was folded. It wasn't folded to fit in the package for mailing--the package was plenty big for it to lay flat. The visor was folded to fit into the clear inner wrap. Another reviewer has mentioned they had the same experience. Folding the visor put a permanent crease in the bill. It is more than a curve, it is a bend. It won't straighten out when the visor is worn. I felt that this visor was a little pricey to begin with, so I am returning it for a refund.
summary: Returning due to crease in the visor

reviewText:
I have a hard time finding cotton undies that fit, are reasonably priced, and are comfortable all day.  This particular cut seems to do well for me.  The only thing that I would complain about is that  they are super high and by the end of the day(in the heat) they stretch out a little.
The price is great for 6 panties, they are all cotton and don't grab and pull at you like some others I have had. The elastic is covered.  They wash and dry well, as well as hold their color.  I would buy these again and be interested in a mid-rise as well as these high-rise panties.
Not overly impressed by Fruit of the Loom quality, expected a little better. Bands around leg and waist simple and subject to ravel.

Usually get the Jockey Elantra but the prices on Amazon were higher than what I can get them on sale around here. So I thought I'd try these instead. For the price, they're okay.
Pros: Didn't shrink and the waist and leg elastic are covered.
Cons: Much thinner fabric and the cut of the leg is higher than I like, although part of that may be that they ran a bit large.
I really like the thin covered waistband. They are very comfortable.
These are full coverage panties.  Cotton is awesome in Florida where its hot and you really need to let things breath.  These dit well and are well sewn and made.  Easy wash and wear.

First the pros: these are very wedgy-resistant, even on my pear shaped butt (what the women's magazines call A-shaped), a rarity. *Some* of the colors are soft. The black and white were both soft *after* laundering with fabric softener (the prints, and, to a lesser degree, the colors, remained crunchy).

Cons: Super unflattering on my shape, which is big butt & thighs. Prints and colors felt rough and cheap, even after washing with fabric softener. While and black pairs did soften up, but this leaves me with only 1/3 of the package value that I'll actually wear.

Overall, they feel cheaply made, even for multipacks. That said, this is mainly because multipacks have improved a lot in the last several years. This fabric reminds me of the elastic waist fruit multipacks from the 90s.

Sidenote: I don't get why they make these brightly colored multipacks--or at least why they don't offer all-neutral colored ones as well. That's purely aesthetic, but given that the neutrals were the only soft ones, it's particularly true.
summary: Unflattering but wedgy-proof on A-shaped/pear-shaped behind; big variation in softness between colors

reviewText: Comfortable, true to size and 100% cotton. These fit my athletic shape very well and don't crawl up. This is a fully high waist cut, so only useful to me under dresses, but I wear dresses pretty often.

The reason for four stars is that they are a little in the large side. My usual size, but still a bit too roomy.

reviewText:
I got these Fruit of the Loom panties for my wife and she really likes them. They are cool, easy, and make my wife feel unfettered with their simplicity and softness. They are also not too big and high waisted and not too small and bikini-like. Rather, the style type is just rightproviding mobility with a touch of sexy.

If you're looking for the breathable cotton (label indicates 95% cotton, 5% spandex), these are your panties. The elastic is not too tight, yet the panty still stays in place, even after my wife used them during a rigorous workout. Unlike the moisture traps of some synthetic undergarments, these are absorbent even under the hot and humid climate of South Florida. For my wife, hygienic health is important when considering undergarments, and these simple but attractive panties serve the dual function of utility and comfort with the added health benefits of wearing cotton.

These panties come in a variety 6-pack. For the value and advantages of wearing cotton, this is a good choice. Im not sure how long they will last over time, but the material and stitching appear to be durable and a good value for the money.

~ Kort

The size chart indicates I'm right in the middle of the size range for 7, but 6 fits me comfortably. I find in all styles of fruit of the loom panties I need to go down a size .

 The cut is as expected, but come up well above my waist-too high on my short torso. This is why I usually wear hipsters or bikinis .

As always, the colors and patterns are random. I got solid black white magenta and teal, and polka dot teal and magenta. I did not like the colors and certainly did not expect polka dot. This is why I usually don't buy these online. Who buys something to wear without knowing what color or pattern you'll get? Just because it's underwear we shouldn't care what we get?
summary: THESE RUN BIG. AND YOU'LL GET A TOTALLY RANDOM SELECTION OF COLORS AND PATTERNS

reviewText: I really love the waistband on these.  It's soft and comfortable, doesn't bind at all, and honestly feels barely there, but it holds the panties up with no slippage.  This is the first time I've tried this cut and I'm going to keep wearing them because they're super comfortable.  The colors are a little basic, I'd probably prefer a more modern palette, but who really sees your underwear, right?

Fruit of the Loom is a great quality clothing brand. I have used this brand for many years. I have never been disappointed by buying their underwear packs, this one is no exception. At first, when I took these out of the package, I wasn't sure if these were actually a size 6 because they looked so BIG! I washed them, sometimes they shrink, they didn't shrink. They fit perfectly! Some underwear, bunch after sitting for a while, and I like that these don't. They also come in awesome different colors!
summary: Quality underwear that will last a long time!

reviewText: These panties are so great, I can hardly believe it!  They are soft, comfortable and really attractive.  I love wearing them.  They wash easily and I really enjoy them.  Can't recommend them highly enough.  Just what I was looking for and I love them.

reviewText: Soft and lightweight. High cut in front is flattering. I like the light, thin waist band and feel it doesn't dig in to my mush (for lack of better word). Over the years, I've been a fan of Fruit of the Loom panties in various styles. They are pretty consistent with regard to overall quality, longevity and comfort. This set maintains that pattern.

These are definitely a high cut on the front, but the elastic is soft and doesn't bind or twist or pinch. The backside offers sufficient coverage for wear under jeans etc. I especially like these when I am riding horses - they don't shift or crawl up in inappropriate ways with lots of body movement. So far, all six pair have been through the laundry with no unraveling or loose seams. My pack has two pairs in polka dots, two solid colors and two in stripes.

What a disappointment from Fruit of the Loom! I have long worn this brand, because of the covered waist and leg bands, which are essential due to a latex allergy. But this set has absolutely NO waistband, despite what the product description says. Instead, the fabric is folded over--about an eighth of an inch--and sewed onto a string of elastic. The panties ride down throughout the day and I have to keep pulling them up. They won't last after a few wears and washes... cheap!

These are pretty good overall. They fit a little smaller than my previous brand of panties, but it's not a huge difference. The waistband is very thin and covered, which is much more comfortable than most other panties I've worn in the past, and I expect it to hold up well over time since the elastic has some protection. The overall shape is good and what I would expect for hi-cuts.  I expect the small amount of stretchiness in the fabric to keep them from becoming overly loose as fast as all-cotton panties. They stay in place nicely during the day and I haven't had any problems with "wedgies." They wash well on a normal wash cycle, and aren't showing any major signs of wear after a few months of use. Most of the colors I got are okay, but the patterned ones and one or two others are rather unattractive. Not exactly sexy underwear, but great for everyday use, and you can always change into something less comfortable for sexy times.
summary: Good for everyday use, very comfortable

reviewText:
I like the colors and the full coverage from behind, but this fabric is very thin.  The elastic at the waist is also probably no more than 1/4 in wide and I do not expect it to hold up for any length of time.
Now for the fit, they run, to me anyway, about 1/2 size too large.  I am going to wash them in hot water and dry them on high to see if that will shrink them to fit.
The leg opening is just right as it is not binding in any way and as I said still allows for full coverage from behind.  They also have only a very faint sign of the dreaded "panty line" underneath my pants and shorts.  But since I wear mostly tunic tops, I am unconcerned with this.
These are mostly good for wearing for everyday around the house, which is when I will be wearing them.  The fabric and elastic are so thin that I will be completely amazed if these hold up for  more than a few months of use and normal laundry.  There are much better quality panties out there.
summary: Run somewhat large and fabric thin

I would have gone back to Wal-Mart, but they didn't have them anymore. I was overjoyed when I found them on Amazon!

It is getting harder and harder to find underwear with just a bit of polyester so there is some stretch--so I got these and they are okay with certain clothes but not others as the stretch is barely there. I won't buy this style again--haha but since there are fewer and fewer brands with just the 5% poly (10% and you are just asking for yeast in one form or another) I may be stuck with this style.

Not that too much sun light is a BIG problem in western Washington state, but it can be a game changer.  This Fedora is perfect for those sunny days out on the links.  The large brim extends over your eyes and keeps the sun burn off your neck. The light straw construction is the right material as well.  Ball caps have a usually trap the heat in on the top your head this wonderful hat is vented to allow a more even flow of air and heat.  Usually the hat band on the ball caps gets sweaty.  Not so with Fedora.  I highly recommend this great hat to everybody.

This light weight vented straw hat is perfect for the hot, humid monsoon season.  The only problem is that it fit too loose.  It is a 7 1/8 57 cm which is my measured size and perfect in other hats.  I think it may be that it is so light weight that the hat itself doesn't hold the size, nor does the light-weight ribbon hat band.  When I replaced it with a leather hatband from an old 7 1/8 hat it worked well.

reviewText:
