It's totally an excellent buy. I'm still waiting on my Madoka one, but I ordered that one from a different seller, so that's understandable. This one arrived four days earlier than expected--which is really good, in my opinion. It literally arrived the day that I absolutely needed it to, and that was with the regular shipping.
I'm extremely satisfied in my purchase, and I'll probably purchase from again, if the need arises.

These leggings are unbelievable. I wear them all the time, not just for exercise, as they are incredibly comfortable and, unlike other leggings, do a great job of smoothing everything out. I specifically bought the capri length due to its versatility - since it's been so cold, these have worked perfectly under knee high boots, but will transition very well to spring and early summer. I've been wearing them since I was about 22 weeks (now 26), and I have no concerns about them lasting for the majority of my pregnancy. Even though they are a bit pricey, they are worth every penny. If you splurge on one thing for maternity clothes, make it these!

I love these pants.  I am a work out pants snob and I'm 6 months pregnant so I have been searching for something that would be the right fit.  These have the perfect amount of stretch and hold.  The maternity belly is very comfortable and they don't slip or move at all like I have found with other maternity pants.  I love the lower back design!  I wish more maternity pants were made this way.

I have been searching high and low for quality maternity workout pants, and these pants are awesome.  They are supportive yet comfortable.  I'm currently wearing them to work out 4-5 times/week, and they are holding up fabulously.  Previously I tried a larger size in Lululemon, but that was uncomfortalbe - I needed actual maternity pants.  The Old Navy ones are cheap and unsupportive.  I can't comment on the Gap ones bc they are always out of stock.  While the Ingrid & Isabel pants are much more expensive than either of those brands, I believe I got what I paid for.

I was 118 pre-pregnancy, am 151 at 27 weeks (yup!), and the small fits me perfectly.

Thank you Ingrid & Isabel for realizing that some of us are not willing to sacrifice quality during the 9 mos. we are sacrificing our bodies!

I am exceedingly pleased with this product. I am 5 1/2 months pregnant with my 2nd child. I ordere these workout/excercise pants for the 5K Breast Cancer walk and AIDS Walk and I am so pleased. These pants not only look great but the belly support is amazing. My belly was cradled and lifted all day while I walked.
I was hesitant because the price was a bit high but I must say i can not live without.
WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!

reviewText: Very comfortable! Good quality.

reviewText: I love this workout pants. They fold over in the back does ride a little low, but it hasn't bothered me yet. I guess, as I get bigger, it could, but for now, these are great for a workout class!

As someone who has been practicing yoga for 10 years and teaching yoga for 5, finding a quality pair of yoga pants that didn't slump with my bump (distracting me in practice), was crucial! I also practice hot vinyasa yoga and needed pants that were not see-through but breathable enough to manage those 90' studio ptactices. I'm so happy these pants fit the bill!! I typically purchase Lululemon pants and wear a size 8 with their pants, and I bought these in a medium. I am 5'4", pre-pregnancy weight is 150, and my current weight is 168; I'm 24 weeks along and fully expect to wear these through the end of my pregnancy. The mediums fit very well, much like my Lulus, and the capris hit perfectly on my calf; I don't think the longer ones would be necessary for me or for hot vinyasa practices. I am very happy with these pants: the fit, the quality, how they move and breathe with me in hot yoga practices--they are a game changer. I know the sticker price is higher than other maternity yoga pants out there, but these are so worth it.

I'm not sure if I will be able to wear them during my 3rd trimester, but I do hope so since these pants are not cheap.  My best description is if these were jeans, these would be the skinny jeans. And Amazon is amazing because the first pair I got had a hole in the crotch and I didn't notice it until I was wearing them - I sent them back and they immediately sent me a new pair.  BUY THESE, YOU WONT REGRET IT.

These fit wonderfully, hold your belly in securely and are a great price!  I am 5'8" and 175 pounds currently during my pregnancy and I ordered a size M (which was my pre pregnancy size as well) and these fit perfect with room to get me through my 3rd trimester.  Would highly recommend.

These are fantastic pants! I'm a group fitness instructor; I teach three to four times a week. I had been making do with my pre-pregnancy pants, but  started to feel uncomfortable in them (mainly because they cut into my bladder!). I decided to go ahead and purchase maternity active pants and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I'm 21w along, so I don't need the full panel yet. I wear them folded over for now and am very pleased with the cross-back panel which ensures that they lay smoothly, even folded over.

My only word of advice: they run just a smidge small. I'm a solid size 2 (pre-pregnancy, obviously) and I wavered between ordering an XS or S. The fact that S was available for Prime shipping tipped the scales towards the S and I have to say that I am so thankful. They are very fitted and I really don't think I could have fit into the XS.

I'm only 24 weeks along and don't think these will be large enough for over 30 weeks and I'm quite active and can still wear non-maternity yoga pants so was a bit disappointed that they ran so small.

These were amazing and saved me during pregnancy!!!! They don't show any "dimples" on the backside and they suck everything in. Plenty of room for the belly to grow, and I had a huge pregnant belly. I would size down, these do run just a bit big. I am normally not a medium, I'm 5'5" 170 pre baby, and mediums fit. If they are too big at first, just fold down the belly material. I also live in Louisiana and had a simmer pregnancy. These were not terribly hot as I feared they might be. Wish I would've bought them sooner and bought 4 pairs!
summary: These were amazing and saved me during pregnancy

reviewText: Very comfy & good for working out.
These are my favorite workout capris ever.  They fit over my belly without issue, and I love the crossing in the lower back area.  Not restrictive, and they aren't see through, which is great!
summary: These are my favorite workout capris ever

reviewText: My favorite purchase of my entire pregnancy.  Much better than any other pregnancy capri I tried on.  This capri is supportive, whereas the high priced "yoga pants" at the main maternity stores offered no support and actually started falling down the second time I wore them (the yoga pants also did not flatter my backside).  I love, love, love these pants, if I have another child I will probably order a second pair.  I cannot recommend them enough!  I ordered a small and they fit as expected, I have found that in this brand I did not need to size up in dresses or these pants, although the work out tops and tank tops seem to run a little small. I am 33 weeks now and can no longer run due to pain, but I have used these for running, walking, pilates, and yoga and will continue to use these to exercise until I give birth, and will probably wear them a few weeks after!  You can't run outside in them if it's hot as they are a little thick (but that's why they are supportive!), but I live in Florida and don't run in any pants outside, so that wasn't an issue for me.

Someone compared these to Lululemon..but I would disagree. That being said, I feel well supported in them. I took one star away for how the pants fit on my back. I don't find the overlapping sections on the back very comfortable and usually have to adjust multiple times in order to make it work. The full belly panel does provide nice support for running or the elliptical.
summary: I don't find the overlapping sections on the back very comfortable and usually have to adjust multiple times in order ...

reviewText: Nice and thick. Comfy over the belly too! No shine or sheerness
Great quality and very comfortable!
(Lionel's wife) Be generous with sizing, because they are snug yet soft and comfortable. The support is amazing.
I got these same pants at Target for $29.99!! I love them but don't pay this much for them....
summary: I love them but don't pay this much for them

reviewText: Very high quality, one of my favorite pair of maternity workout pants.
summary: one of my favorite pair of maternity workout pants

reviewText: Really great, sturdy material and high quality spandex. Runs a tid-bit small but still so glad I made this purchase!

reviewText: I liked the fit of these leggings but am returning due to the fabric.  I find it itchy and I don't like how the pants look shiny in the light. I may have kept them if they were cheaper but for $78 I'll just go buy another pair of Lululemon's (which stretch enough to fit over my bump).

These are by far the best maternity leggings I've purchased. They are not see through at all! They are as if Lululemon made their own line of maternity leggings. Nice and thick material that holds everything in and hides cellulite! I've tried many other maternity leggings from Motherhood to Target, and these are THE best. Definitely worth paying more for them, wish I wouldn't have wasted my money on other cheaper ones. Will
summary: These are by far the best maternity leggings I've purchased

reviewText: These are fantastic! It is so hard to find good maternity workout clothes and Ingrid & Isabel have gotten it right. Don't say no to these because of price - they are the fourth pair I have tried and I wish I had bought them sooner. They are made of good material and have held up well as I go to the gym 4-5 times per week. I'm really picky about the length of my workout pants and these fall exactly mid-calf on me (5'5"). In addition, I'm currently 31 weeks pregnant and still have room to grow in the belly - fully expect to last until I deliver.
summary: These are fantastic! It is so hard to find good maternity ...

reviewText: Today is the first day I am wearing these capris but they definitely seem worth the price!  I am 5 mos pregnant and hope to be able to wear them throughout the rest of my pregnancy.  highly recommended.

These fit very well, and are really comfortable to run/lift/do yoga in.  Great fit, great pair of pants. My only complaint would be that I wish they came in tech fabric that wicked sweat, but I guess we can't have everything, can we?

I've been looking for a nice heavy weight (opaque) workout pant to accommodate my expanding pregnancy belly and thought I would give these a try since the reviews looked promising and I've had good luck so far with Ingrid and Isabel products in general.  These capris did not disappoint!  They are supportive, looks great, fit true to size (I ordered a size Large: I'm 5'10 and finishing up my 5th month at around 185 lbs) and the waist is designed so that I should continue to have room as this kiddo grows.  I love that the back is cut out so that the waistband can be folded down or comfortably worn up over my belly.  The low cut back also keeps the pants a little cooler which I'm sure will come in handy this summer.  My initial opinion is that these pants were pretty pricey, but now my opinion is that they are worth every penny.  I might even splurge for a second pair because I'm sure these will be great after delivery as well.  These are a pregnancy (and post pregnancy) must have.
I've worn these from 4-9 months and they fit great. Very comfortable and versatile.

These are the best pregnancy leggings I have bought and I have bought several searching for the best fit. They are not see through like most, they're tight so they hold everything in, and they are comfortable.
summary: These are the best pregnancy leggings I have bought and I have bought ...

reviewText: These pants are awesome. Little warm for summer but great fit and very comfortable.
Worth every penny.  Order pre-pregnancy size

Best maternity workout pants!  Great quality and very supportive.

These tights were great for the last few months of my pregnancy. There was good belly support and they didn't ride down in the back. After 4 months of heavy wear and washing, there was no visible thinning and very little pilling.

I'm 22 weeks pregnant and have gained 13 pounds, now at a whopping 133.  The small fits great.  I've gained quite a bit in my hips so I was a little worried but didn't have any issues.  These are seriously amazing, tried on so many other pairs of yoga pants.  These ones are the most comfortable and flattering... Not at all see through either
summary: The small fits great. I've gained quite a bit in my hips ...

reviewText: I'm 5 months pregnant and ordered these maternity active pants. I absolutely love them. I participate in a high intensity workout with high knees, ice skaters, mountain climbers, jumping jacks, etc and these stayed put the entire class. Not pregnant, I am a size 4 and I ordered the small. They fit perfect now, and I'm hoping they will still fit in 3 more months. The material is heavy duty, breathable, and some what stretchable which I like because then the pants stay put. I'm not having to pull them up the entire class. The belly band in the front is great because sometimes my tank tops will ride up when I'm pregnant and nothing shows. The belly band isn't high all the way around (only the front), which I also love so that you have more breathable room in the back. I would recommend these pants to anyone. Well worth the money.
summary: I absolutely love them. I participate in a high intensity workout ...

reviewText: I was a 27 before being pregnant and the small fits perfect. I'm 5'2" and the pants hit at my calf. I also got the shower pair that hits at your knee bend. These pants get 5 stars for quality. It's thick, really high quality fabric that is constructed really well. I'm a lulu pant wearer and they don't fit well pregnant. These are SO comfortable! I love! I never leave reviews, but these pants deserve everyone knowing to buy them if they can!
LOVED these!

These capris are great quality and provide great support.  I'm 6 mos pregnant and wanted something for walking and yoga.  The fabric is thick, not sheer at all, and very supportive all the way up.  I thought the criss-cross back would be weird but it's not at all.

I previously purchased Beyond Yoga maternity pants and was so disappointed with the quality and support (they wouldn't stay up, kept falling down by butt - wish I was kidding), so I was eager to find yoga pants I can wear throughout my pregnancy.

These maternity pants are the best pants I have found and this is my second pregnancy. They are so comfortable. I bought them right before a road trip and I'm wearing them in the car.  I wish I could buy 10 pairs of these. Highly recommend!
summary: Love these pants and I'm picky!

reviewText: These pants are awesome! I will for sure where them with boots too. They are very thick, warm material. I ordered a small 5'3" 130 at 20 wks and they fit great with room to grow in the belly.

These pants are amazing! They are the only pair of yoga maternity pants that I have found to be useful (they are thick enough and super comfortable). If you're questioning whether to buy them or not ((because of the high price)) just do it! You'll be happy you splurged. The price is worth it. Old navy and gap just don't have anything to compare to these maternity yoga pants. Follow the sizing chart and you should be good to go. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because of the price.
Loved these leggings while pregnant!  They provide the coverage that every prego wants/needs to help hide the extra lumps and bumps.  They are not see through either...great quality!

I was surprised by how thick the material was, but still comfortable and flexible. I need for winter months of my pregnancy, so I've kept it. I wouldn't keep if for the summer, too thick. I like my workout clothes to be light easy to get into.

Favorite maternity pants. They were a little loose in the belly area when I was in my first trimester. But they started fitting better as I got bigger. They are incredibly comfortable and I love working our in them! I even wear them with a cute shirt and it looks good for casual wear.
Great maternity work out pants.  Wish they were a little cheaper but I will def use them frequently through pregnancy and postpartum workouts.
I bought two pair because I love these so much. They really support my growing belly.
Most amazing workout pants ever ... Spend the money because the fit and quality are amazing. Keeps everything in nice and tight!

These are nice pants for working out while pregnant.  I am 5'3" and at 128#'s so far, and the XS fit well.  There's room to grow in the belly.  They are, however, a bit pricey.  I did find a similar pair at Target after the fact that were less than half the cost.

I've been looking for over-the-belly yoga pants for over a month. I have been folding down the bands of my existing yoga pants but always felt like my rear end was about to be exposed and I just wasn't comfortable! I was hesitant to buy these online without being able to see the fabric but went ahead... THANK GOODNESS.

The pants are the perfect thickness - I'm not worried about flashing anything through/over my pants, the belly panel is great both fully extended or folded down, and the cross of fabric at the lower back is great support. If these weren't so expensive I would have 5 pairs - for now AND after pregnancy! I feel so much better in these - I've even been wearing them with boots and tunics since I can't find a good pair of leggings.

I can't recommend these enough!

After searching many places for decent maternity exercise pants, I finally found them!  I am normally a size 10, 5'6" and am in my 25th week presently.  I ordered a Large because I have a large bottom/thighs... along with the growing belly.  These fit perfectly and have wonderful belly coverage.  Don't waste your time on cheap exercise pants, go ahead and get these and save yourself some trouble!
These pants fit great and are very comfortable.  It is great to find maternity work out pants that stay in place.

reviewText: I love the sweater.  It fit just right.  The only problem was an odor that was remedied by washing it with fabric softener.  I will have this forever.

I bought this sweater as a Christmas gift for my college daughter.  I had to air this sweater out for three days, and I had to wash it twice! It smelled like a sweat factory in China. I know what that smell like too!  I was hoping that hanging the sweater, dry and wet it would stretch a little, it did not.  You could not send this back.  So disappointed with this purchase.  I sold it to another college girl who is the size of a 12 year old.

Love love love this dress which came with the additional benefit that it arrived just seven days after the order was placed, although the promised delivery time was much longer.  The fabric is a stretchy polyester which some describe as "scuba material", I think meaning it is slightly heavier fabric than your standard clingy polyester.  I agree and think it is a good weight for cool weather wear.  It is midi length, which, aside from being sexy and of the moment, means it does not ride up.  This is a form fitting dress, but it is not overly clingy.  I may have been able to go with a smaller size, but given the inability to try it on in advance of ordering, I am happy with the fit of the size 10 I ordered (I am 5"3 and generally wear a size 9 in juniors and 6 in misses).  Overall I found this dress to provide excellent on trend value for the price and I can't wait to wear it and get lots of admiring or envious double takes!

Hello,

RE: Nice Shades 56" Military Style Canvas Web Belt w/ Silver Roller Buckle...

Reviewing the pictures, the item resting on the packaging was in perfect condition. Buckle shiny chrome or silver and the canvas web charcoal color 56". It actually arrived faster than scheduled which is always a plus. I haven't altered the belt and to date it hasn't frayed.

Two (2) points are given to reviewers seeking to buy canvas web belts: (1) if the belt is too tight it will fold on your waist and (2) buy a belt clip which works the same as a tie clip by keeping the belt in-place even if the buckle loosens via general movement.

Thank you,

--- MMS

This is a rather cool wind up pocket watch, with a definite vintage look , and yes, it would be fine for steampunk.

It's fun to open it up and watch the gears go around and round. Fascinating!

After being wound It kept fine time.

One little thing- since it's vintage look the hands aren't luminous or anything, so it's hard to read in poor light or dark.

This is an excellent quality replica of an English mid-Victorian dual hunting case silver pocket watch, with exposed works. I sympathize with the younger reviewers who needed instructions, which certainly should be included. But if you're familiar with pocket watches you will have no trouble using this one. And if you're not familiar with pocket watches, perhaps you should be. There is a ceremonial elegance to removing the watch from your vest watch pocket, snapping open the case, and reading the graceful hands against the Roman numerals; quite unlike replying to texts with your thumbs while chatting with friends.

The watch is satisfyingly heavy, with solid stem and fob, and detachable chain. Setting and winding have a smooth feel. The case opens and closes with authoritative snaps. It keeps time acceptably well. The works are visible enough to figure out how the watch works, and if you go in for precision machinery, has an hypnotic appeal.

I recommend this for lovers of fine design and engineering.

Try ZERO stars!  This thing is JUNK! Dead on Arrival.  I wound it, set the time and then the hands spun freely until the spring was unwound.

DON'T Bother with this one, you'll be shipping it back like I had to.

I had been meaning to buy this shirt for a long time when I saw it online. It is just so cute. I just got it in the mail today which was great to get it before the new year, and I am very happy with it! It fits very well and is sooooooooooo soft. I was scared that the material would be that rough chiffon stuff or be close to it in texture but it is actually very smooth and silky. It's very light. What I loved is the back of it which the picture doesn't show. There is white floral lace in the back on the shoulders which completely adds more cuteness to the shirt. I remembered reading a review on this shirt saying that it feels like a girly shirt yet it's sophisticated at the same time and I would agree completely. I would recommend wearing this with a black pencil skirt or trousers since it's so cute and girly and it'd look lovely to add some womanly-ness to it. It could be worn to the office, to school, or wherever. It is a shirt that would be very easy to work with in terms of being classy or casual. The bows and the buttons on the front are just making me squeal with delight. SO adorable. It was also true to the sizing chart. I got it in a size small and was very happy with how it fit.
It fits as expected. Shipping was long but worth it. I got 2 things from her and both were perfect. Will be coming back.

But it fits nicely, though there's a gap because of my chest. But that's to be expected on any button up shirt when you're quite busty. I got a large, and I am thoroughly pleased with with the shirt. It's a soft, nice fabric, and it's not as sheer as I expected it to be.

reviewText: This top is super cute! I have received tons of compliments from both males and females. The top is as shown in the picture. The fabric may not be the best, but it is not bad either. I would definitely recommend this product.

For the 9 bucks i paid this was worth it and more! I could have gone down a size but it is still a perfect fit. Not too baggy or too tight. I live in CA, and shipping is from Hong Kong, and my package came in 8 shipping days. :) Which made me happy because when you purchase it says 3-4 weeks. Now back on to the garment itself, The bows are not printed but actually sewn on. The material seems sturdy enough not to delicate. On the tag it says it can be machine washed. Some people have had bad experiences with allegra k. So i was skeptical at first to buy anything. However I bought 3 blouses and all seem to be well made and the came as they looked. brand new and had no problems. Maybe I'm just lucky lol :) but id recommend this to any of my friends and family. This blouse is adorable and isn't sheer. I'd say go down a size though when ordering blouses from this brand because they do run a bit big.

My estimated time was July 26 - August 13, but it arrived on July 11. That was 10 days from Hong Kong to California. I really recommend this shirt!

reviewText:
I ordered this shirt for all the positive reviews it got; however, I was extremely disappointed when I received it. Either they made a mistake with the sewing or the shirt is simply completely different from the picture. In the photo the front and back part of the shirt seem to be just cut from one piece of fabric. The shirt I received had the top part sewn to the bottom part so there was a line right above the pockets. Also it seemed like the top part was from a size L pattern and the bottom from a small size pattern as the pockets on the shirt I received were below my breasts (I had ordered a size small). Also in the photo, the pocket flaps are cut into a triangle, my shirt's pocket flaps were a rhombus shaped and you could not button them down, they just flapped below my breasts.
Anyway, maybe I just received a flawed shirt but that is no excuse - bad quality control. I was very disappointed!
It came without tags on it, the size was not shown, nor the washing method. The fabric was cheap, it broke after the first washing.

I took a chance wearing these to work, but I could not detect anything out of the ordinary once I slipped my blouse on, so I decided to risk it. I will say that trying to place them equally on both sides was somewhat difficult and required me peeling them off several times until I got it right.
